akn:section.akn:heading: Elevation of disputes to the Chief Acquisition Officer

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 1110. Elevation of disputes to the Chief Acquisition Officer If, after 90 days following the elevation to the Chief Acquisition Officer of any design or other dispute regarding level 1 or level 2 acquisition, the dispute remains unresolved, the Commandant shall provide to the appropriate congressional committees a detailed description of the issue and the rationale underlying the decision taken by the Chief Acquisition Officer to resolve the issue. (Added Pub. L. 116–283, div. G, title LVXXXV [LXXXV], § 8501(a)(5), Jan. 1, 2021, 134 Stat. 4745.)
Editorial Notes Prior ProvisionsA prior section 1110 was renumbered section 5110 of this title.
